data.name: str_Shell_AboutPage_Title
data.value: About

data.name: str_Shell_AboutPage_LblIntro
data.value:
MejorAppT is an app geared towards students' mental health and emotional wellbeing. It aims to provide an accessible and safe tool for students to track their mental health, manage academic stress and access useful self-care and wellbeing resources.
This app is in no way intended to replace any form of therapy or traditional medicine. If you are experiencing severe symptoms, please seek professional advice first.
Click on any of the following categories to get more information.

data.name: str_Shell_AboutPage_ScientificBase
data.value: Academic and scientific basis

data.name: str_Shell_AboutPage_ScientificBase_Msg
data.value: All the tests herein presented are adapted as closely as possible from the following studies: • "Propiedades psicométricas de un cuestionario para la evaluación de la ansiedad ante los exámenes en adolescentes": Rosa Torrano-Martínez, Juan Manuel Ortigosa-Quiles, Antonio Riquelme-Marín and José Antonio López-Pina (University of Murcia). • "Comprendiendo el papel de la práctica física y el género en los trastornos alimentarios en estudiantes adolescentes españoles": Gema Sanchis-Soler, Irene León-Calero, Sergio Sebastia-Amat, María Antonia Parra-Rizo, Miguel García-Jaén (University of Alicante, International University of Valencia, Miguel Hernández University of Elche).

data.name: str_Shell_AboutPage_Credits
data.value: Credits

data.name: str_Shell_AboutPage_Credits_Msg
data.value: This app has been developed by the IT department of IES Gregorio Prieto. Namely, the development team is formed by the following members: Esther Cantón, Francisco Carrero, Alberto Navarro and Manuel Valdepeñas.

data.name: str_Shell_BtnClose
data.value: Close

data.name: str_Shell_HelpPage_Title
data.value: Help

data.name: str_Shell_HelpPage_MainHeader
data.value: Welcome to MejorAppT! Here you can consult the most essential help to learn how to use and navigate the app. Click on any of the following categories to get more information.

data.name: str_Shell_HelpPage_TopBar
data.value: Navigation bar

data.name: str_Shell_HelpPage_TopBar_Msg
data.value: In the top navigation bar, you can change between the two main tabs that make up the app: the main menu and your profile. Below you'll find more details about each of these tabs. • By clicking on (i), you can see information about this project, the involved developers and the studies that endorse this app. • By clicking on (?), you can access the app's help, as you will have already been able to see for yourself. • Finally, by clicking on the kebab menu (the three little dots in the top right corner), you will see a menu with options that allow you to log out, modify the current user or delete the user and all stored data.

data.name: str_Shell_HelpPage_MainMenu
data.value: Main menu and tests

data.name: str_Shell_HelpPage_MainMenu_Msg
data.value:
From the main menu, you'll be able to take one of three tests: • Quick anxiety test: consists of 20 questions and can be completed in approximately 2 minutes. • Complete anxiety test: consists of 48 questions and can be completed in approximately 6 minutes. • Eating disorders test: consists of 26 questions and can be completed in approximately 3 minutes.
In each test, each question will be presented individually. Each question consists of 5 possible answers, and you must select one to advance to the next question. Your progress will be saved automatically, so that if, due to your own decision or external factors, the application closes, you have the option to resume your progress at another time. Once you have answered all the questions, the final result will be calculated and advices will be displayed on screen according to your answers. Your test will be saved in the system so that you can consult these same advices from your profile.

data.name: str_Shell_HelpPage_MyProfile_Msg
data.value: In the "My profile" tab, you can see the details of the profile currently logged in to the application (name, age and gender). Remember that you can change these details or even create a new user from the menu in the top right corner. You can also change your profile picture by clicking on the picture itself. Just below, you will see a list of the tests you have completed with this user in chronological order, with the most recent one first. If you click on any of them, the tips associated with your answers in that test will be displayed. Finally, you can quickly and directly consult the tips of the last test you took by clicking on the ‘Consult last test’ button or delete all your history and start from scratch by clicking on the "Delete history" button.

data.name: str_Shell_ModifyPage_Apply
data.value: Apply

data.name: str_Shell_DeleteProfile_Question
data.value: Delete profile?

data.name: str_Shell_DeleteProfile_Msg
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete your profile? Warning, all your data will be deleted! You will not be able to undo this action!

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question2
data.value: I think the teacher is constantly looking at me.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question3
data.value: As I start to read the exam, my eyesight blurs and I don't understand what I am reading.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question4
data.value: While I am taking an exam, I think I am doing very badly.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question5
data.value: If I'm 5 minutes late for an exam I don't go in, I hide around the school or try to leave.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question6
data.value: When a group of classmates talks about the exam before the teacher arrives, I get nervous.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question7
data.value: For me it is a relief or reassurance when, for whatever reason, an exam is postponed.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question8
data.value: I can't get any sleep the night before an exam.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question9
data.value: I think I won't be able to pass the exam, even if I have studied.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question10
data.value: At the start of the exam, as soon as I read the questions, I hand it in blank to the teacher and return to my seat.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question11
data.value: When I'm taking an exam, my heart beats very fast.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question12
data.value: After taking an exam I feel I have done badly and think about disappearing or hurting myself.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question13
data.value: It is hard or impossible for me to eat food before taking an exam.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question14
data.value: I get sick and make excuses for not taking an exam.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question15
data.value: In the hours/moments before the exam I feel sick to my stomach or my stomach gets upset and I have to go to the toilet.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question16
data.value: It takes me a long time to make up my mind when answering most of the questions or handing in the exam.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question17
data.value: Before entering the exam I speak very quickly and move around more than usual.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question18
data.value: During exams, I find it hard to concentrate and I sometimes get blocked.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question19
data.value: I establish a pre-exam ritual and if I can't do it, I find an excuse and don't enter the exam.

data.name: str_QuickTest_Question20
data.value: I can't sit still while taking an exam, I usually bite my nails or my pen.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question1
data.value: My hands sweat during exams.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question2
data.value: When I have been doing the exam for a while, I feel discomfort in my stomach and the need to defecate.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question3
data.value: As I start to read the exam, my eyesight blurs and I don't understand what I am reading.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question4
data.value: If I'm 5 minutes late for an exam I don't go in, I hide around the school or try to leave.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question5
data.value: The conditions in which an exam takes place (too much noise, heat, cold, sun...) influence me by increasing my nervousness.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question6
data.value: When I finish an exam, my head hurts.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question7
data.value: When I've been doing an exam for a while, I feel short of breath, very hot and like I'm going to faint.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question8
data.value: I get nervous when the teacher stops just beside me and I can't continue answering.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question9
data.value: I get nervous when I see the teacher with the exams before entering the classroom.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question10
data.value: My hands and/or arms feel rigid during the exam.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question11
data.value: Before entering the exam I feel a knot in my stomach, which disappears when I start writing.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question12
data.value: At the start of the exam, I hand it in blank to the teacher as soon as I read the questions and return to my seat.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question13
data.value: After the exam I cry easily, thinking how badly I have done even though I don't know the result.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question14
data.value: While I'm doing the exam, I think I'm doing really badly.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question15
data.value: I get nervous when the others begin to hand in the exam before me.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question16
data.value: I think the teacher is constantly looking at me.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question17
data.value: I usually bite my nails or my pen during exams.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question18
data.value: I feel a strong urge to go to the bathroom during the exam.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question19
data.value: I can't sit still while doing the exam (I move my feet, I move my pen, I look around, I look at the time...).

data.name: str_FullTest_Question20
data.value: I get sick and make excuses for not taking an exam.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question21
data.value: For me it is a relief or reassurance when, for some reason, an exam is postponed.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question22
data.value: I think I will not be able to pass the exam, even if I have studied.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question23
data.value: Before doing the exam I think that I can't remember anything and that I'm going to fail.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question24
data.value: I can't get any sleep the night before an exam.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question25
data.value: I get nervous when the classroom is full of people.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question26
data.value: I have felt dizzy and felt like vomiting during an exam.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question27
data.value: Moments before the exam, my mouth is dry and I find it hard to swallow.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question28
data.value: If I sit in the front rows to take the exam, my nervousness increases.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question29
data.value: If the exam has a fixed deadline, my nervousness increases and I do worse.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question30
data.value: I get nervous in very big classrooms.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question31
data.value: When I'm taking an exam, my heart beats very fast.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question32
data.value: As I enter the room where the exam is taking place, my legs shake.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question33
data.value: I get nervous in rooms that are too small.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question34
data.value: When a group of classmates talks about the exam before the teacher arrives, I get more nervous.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question35
data.value: When I exit the exam, I get the feeling I have done terribly.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question36
data.value: I think I will get nervous and I will forget everything.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question37
data.value: It takes me a long time to decide whether to answer most of the questions or to hand in the exam.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question38
data.value: I'd feel nervous if I had to take a personal interview exam.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question39
data.value: I'd feel nervous if I had to take an oral exam in public.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question40
data.value: I'd feel nervous if I had to present a project in class.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question41
data.value: I'd feel nervous if I had to take a written exam with alternative questions.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question42
data.value: I'd feel nervous if I had to take a written exam with open questions.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question43
data.value: I'd feel nervous if I had to take a written exam to develop a whole topic.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question44
data.value: I'd feel nervous if I had to take a written exam in front of a selection board.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question45
data.value: I'd feel nervous if I had to take a general knowledge test.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question46
data.value: I'd feel nervous if I had to take an exam in calculus or maths problems.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question47
data.value: I'd feel nervous if I had to take an exam with physical or gymnastic exercises.

data.name: str_FullTest_Question48
data.value: I'd feel nervous if I had to take a practical exam (typewriting, handling a computer, doing a project, drawing, etc.).

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question1
data.value: I am distressed at the thought of being too fat.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question2
data.value: I try not to eat when I'm hungry.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question3
data.value: Food is a regular concern for me.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question4
data.value: I have suffered from binge eating crises where I felt like I couldn't stop eating.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question5
data.value: I cut my food into small pieces.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question6
data.value: I know the amount of calories of the food I eat.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question7
data.value: I try not to eat foods that contain a lot of carbohydrates (bread, rice, potatoes, etc.).

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question8
data.value: I get the impression that others would like to see me eat more.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question9
data.value: I vomit after eating.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question10
data.value: I feel very guilty after eating.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question11
data.value: I am obsessed with the desire to be thinner.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question12
data.value: When I do sport I mainly think about burning calories.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question13
data.value: Other people think I'm too thin.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question14
data.value: The idea of having fat areas on my body and/or having cellulite worries me.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question15
data.value: I take longer than others to eat.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question16
data.value: I try not to eat food that contains sugar.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question17
data.value: I eat dietetic food.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question18
data.value: I get the impression that my life revolves around food.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question19
data.value: I have good self-control when it comes to food.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question20
data.value: I get the feeling that others are pressuring me to eat more.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question21
data.value: I spend too much time thinking about food.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question22
data.value: I don't feel well after eating sweets.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question23
data.value: I'm on a diet.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question24
data.value: I like to have an empty stomach.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question25
data.value: I like to try new, tasty and calorie-rich dishes.

data.name: str_EatingTest_Question26
data.value: After meals I have the urge to vomit.

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice1_Title
data.value: Accept uncertainty

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice1_Content
data.value: Accept that you don't know everything and that it's perfectly fine to feel doubts during an exam. This will help you not overburden yourself.

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice2_Title
data.value: Think positive

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice2_Content
data.value: Try to keep a positive attitude and focus on all the things you've learned instead of worrying about what you don't know.

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice3_Title
data.value: Identify your toxic thoughts

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice3_Content
data.value: Identify those feelings about exams, like "I'm not going to pass", "I'm a failure", etc. This will help you change them.

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice4_Title
data.value: Block and change your negative thoughts

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice4_Content
data.value: When facing a negative thought, say "Stop" and try to see the situation from a more objective point of view; this will help you see the reality of the situation.

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice5_Title
data.value: Empower yourself

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice5_Content
data.value: These simple body postures give instant security and confidence. https://www.youtube.com/embed/jnOfzrDZYrA

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice6_Title
data.value: Accept anxiety

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice6_Content
data.value: Occasional anxiety is normal and can help us be more focused. It is not a danger to you.

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice7_Title
data.value: Talk to yourself

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice7_Content
data.value: Slowly read this paragraph when you have an anxiety attack: "All these symptoms you are currently feeling, even if they are unpleasant, ARE NOT DANGEROUS, YOU ARE NOT GOING TO DIE, NOR ARE YOU GOING TO LOSE CONTROL OF YOUR BREATHING. This crisis you are feeling has a beginning, a peak and an end. This means that whatever you do, it will end, even if you do nothing. So avoid trying to control or fight it, that will make it worse. Instead, listen to your body and try to name whatever you are feeling right now. It is your body and the psychophysiological response it triggers when it thinks it's in danger. Therefore, these are normal reactions in my body and something terrible is not going to happen. SO REMEMBER: YOU ARE NOT IN DANGER AND IN A FEW MINUTES IT WILL PASS".

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice8_Title
data.value: Change your attentional focus

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice8_Content
data.value: Think or note down: 5 things you can see at the moment, 4 things you can touch, 3 things you can hear, 2 things you can smell, 1 thing you can taste.

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice9_Content
data.value: Create a pre-exam habit, it builds confidence and trust. For example: sit down, get your pens ready, and take three slow, deep breaths while thinking the phrase "I can do anything".

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice9_Title
data.value: Establish a routine

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice10_Title
data.value: Practice relaxation techniques

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice10_Content
data.value: Practice relaxation techniques. It can help you mitigate anxiety and improve your ability to face exam situations. Would you like to learn them? Videos in Spanish: https://www.youtube.com/embed/F9R-uz9QZ58?si=HA2sN9VasJnKU8jk https://www.youtube.com/embed/ycSQVQqzk24?si=Y9TtCqZRvzbN7gUV https://www.youtube.com/embed/W5k__liBQzI?si=s2-Ukr5BBSlT6zxd https://www.youtube.com/embed/JPfg6QEszNk?si=4mq7WeC2ETNH-qzr

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice11_Title
data.value: Use metaphors

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice11_Content
data.value: Slowly read the following metaphor: "Imagine you're at sea, a seemingly calm place, and suddenly, a massive wave appears. As it approaches you feel afraid and you instinctively run away from it, but by getting away, the wave becomes stronger and more frightening and seemingly continues to chase you. The farther you run away from the wave, the bigger it becomes, and the farther you run away, the stronger it gets. However, if you don't avoid the wave, the crash will be strong at first, but you will eventually dry out and keep enjoying the sea. If another massive wave comes along and you still don't avoid it, the crash and the damage will undoubtedly be weaker. Oftentimes problems are exactly the same; our feelings, memories or emotions may be unpleasant to begin with, but if we run away from them, all we'll do is make them bigger and more important. However, if we do not avoid them and, on the contrary, accept them as they are, even though they may torment us a little at first, they will eventually become commonplace and less important, letting us be more flexible and permissive with ourselves."

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice12_Title
data.value: Identify, block and change

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice12_Content
data.value: Identify toxic thoughts regarding exams, like "I'm not going to pass" or "I'm a failure". Block those thoughts, say "Stop". Try to see the situation from a more objective point of view; this will help you see the reality of the situation.

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice13_Title
data.value: Study every day

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice13_Content
data.value: Study more often, not longer. Space out study sessions on the same subject. Don't binge study just the day before, you run the risk of blocking yourself and going blank.

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice14_Title
data.value: Organise yourself

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice14_Content
data.value: Keep your diary up to date. Prepare a study timetable and follow a plan to cover all subjects. Review your study techniques (ask your counsellor if you have any doubts). Solve all your doubts about the subject with your teacher.

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice15_Title
data.value: Watch your habits

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice15_Content
data.value: Get enough sleep, especially the day before the exam (necessary for good concentration), exercise, eat a balanced and healthy diet (avoid energy drinks and alcohol).

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice16_Title
data.value: Seek support

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice16_Content
data.value: Talk to a friend, relative or teacher about your worries and seek their support.

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice17_Title
data.value: Seek professional help

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice17_Content
data.value: If you cannot control your anxiety and it is affecting your everyday life, seek professional help.

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice18_Title
data.value: Practice self-observation

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice18_Content
data.value: Pay attention and write down when you have anxiety and study why; that will help you know what your triggers are (several exams in the same week, for example) and deal with that anxiety: ● When it happened: Monday, considering that I have 3 exams. ● What I'm feeling: Anxiety, trouble breathing... ● Now see the situation from the outside (like in a third-person video game) and explain it. ● What I can do to cope with the situation: Focus on one exam and when you finish with another one...; help yourself with breathing and relaxation techniques...

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice19_Title
data.value: Make a plan that you can stick to

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice19_Content
data.value: If you avoid exams, going to class or studying because of your anxiety, set yourself attainable goals.

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice20_Title
data.value: Bit by bit

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice20_Content
data.value: Start simple (study at home), follow up with class attendance; go into the exam with confidence.

data.name: str_ResultsPage_Title
data.value: Advices

data.name: str_ResultsPage_LblIntro_Medium
data.value: Your anxiety levels are within the average range. But you need to be careful and continue to monitor your symptoms to prevent the situation from getting out of hand.

data.name: str_ResultsPage_LblIntro_High
data.value: Your anxiety levels are too high. It's important that you learn to manage that emotion, as these levels can give way to important emotional and health problems.

data.name: str_ResultsPage_LblIntro_Low
data.value: Despite sometimes feeling more nervous than usual, your response to these situations is adequate and within the average. Keep it up. Moderate anxiety can help you stay focused on your studies, so long as it is not sustained over time, as it can get out of your control.

data.name: str_ResultsPage_Category_Prevent
data.value: Things you can do before getting to this situation

data.name: str_ResultsPage_Category_SeeMore
data.value: Would you like to know more?

data.name: str_ResultsPage_Category_BadSituation
data.value: If you are in over your head

data.name: str_ResultsPage_LblIntro_Low_2
data.value: Despite sometimes feeling more nervous than usual, your response to these situations is adequate and within the average. Keep it up. Moderate anxiety can help you stay focused on your studies, so long as it is not sustained over time, as it can get out of your control.

data.name: str_ResultsPage_LblIntro_EatingTest
data.value: Thank you for completing the test. Below are recommendations based on your answers. These guidelines are a general guide to help you reflect on your relationship with food. Remember that this test is merely a guideline and does not replace a professional consultation. If you have any doubts or concerns, we recommend that you consult a specialist for a personalised assessment.

data.name: str_EatingAdvice1_Title
data.value: No clinical intervention required

data.name: str_EatingAdvice1_Content
data.value: Congratulations! It appears you have a balanced relationship with food, keep it up. Even though you are not at risk, we believe it would be a good idea for you to stay alert in case your relationship with food changes.

data.name: str_EatingAdvice2_Title
data.value: Urgent clinical assessment

data.name: str_EatingAdvice2_Content
data.value: Your relationship with food is not healthy. Please consult a medical specialist as soon as possible so that they can help you.

data.name: str_EatingAdvice3_Title
data.value: Additional clinical assessment

data.name: str_EatingAdvice3_Content
data.value: Thank you very much for using this app. Please note that this is for guidance only, we recommend that you speak to a health professional or counsellor to address any concerns you may have regarding your eating habits. There are signs that you may be developing an eating disorder.

data.name: str_EatingAdvice4_Title
data.value: Exploratory assessment and preventive monitoring

data.name: str_EatingAdvice4_Content
data.value: We believe your relationship with food worries you based on your eating habits and the emotions they trigger in you. It would be very wise to talk about this issue with someone around you, with judgement and experience, whom you can trust.

data.value: The link can't be opened. Check that it is valid.

data.value: Page 1/X

data.name: str_ResultsPage_BtnFinish
data.value: Return

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice21_Title
data.value: Ho'oponopono technique

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice21_Content
data.value: This Hawaiian technique seeks to clean negative memories and emotions that may affect our lives. Recording in Spanish: https://www.youtube.com/embed/hV3A-BzfGZM?si=uQDjLgWi_8LJmmTV

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice22_Title
data.value: Meditation session

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice22_Content
data.value: Relax and connect with your inner self with this short guided meditation session. Find a quiet place, get comfortable and let the audio guide (in Spanish) you to inner calm. https://www.youtube.com/embed/C6bDxq1S7lw?si=eRZpZsPdmTRhGLxd

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice23_Title
data.value: Ambient music

data.name: str_AnxietyAdvice23_Content
data.value: Ambient music created by our students. Recommended for any of the meditations of other advices. https://www.youtube.com/embed/R5Ji-rDCCh0?si=2w1zvhL1QPskLS87
